result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:49 PM Defendant Charles Allen Rowcliffe appeared by video, in custody from Sawyer County Jail.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt in court for Charles Allen Rowcliffe.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Thomas-Schmidt acknowledges information, waives reading.  DEF enters NG plea.  Court finds probable cause and binds DEF over for trial.

Arraignment on September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

12:59 PM Defendant Charles Rowcliffe appeared by video, in custody from the Sawyer County Jail.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt appeared in person for Charles Allen Rowcliffe. 
Court calls case and recites appearances.  Def Atty indicates to proceed with preliminary hearing. State calls witness Police Officer, Jacob Anderson, sworn in by Judge Yackel. 1:33 PM State begins examination. 1:37 PM Witness identified the DEF, court indicates the record will reflect. Def Atty has no objection. State continues examination. Atty Jennifer Gross has no further questions. 1:38 PM Cross-Examination by Attorney Thomas-Schmidt. 
1:39 PM Attny Thomas-Schmidt no further questions. 11:48 AM State re-direct. 1:40 PM Attorney Jennifer Gross to re-cross.  Def Atty - Objection. Court allows the question to continue.  State - no further questions. Def Atty - no further questions. Court asks attorneys if there are any further witnesses. No further witnesses called. State makes argument and request for bind over. Attny Thomas-Schmidt believes that the State has not met the burden due to the definition and makes argument in regards to definition. Court responds to the Def Atty on the argument. State makes statement on differentiating the terms on Def Atty argument. Court continues to make a statement on the argument. Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.
Arraignment scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Arraignment on September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court resets the preliminary hearing for August 16th. 2022 @1:30 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
